attributes.action: ensure that all road closures, due to traffic schemes/roadworks, are co-ordinated and overseen by all relevant bordering Councils, including County Councils, City Councils and Parish Councils ensuring minimum disruption to road users
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Since the implementation of the A1073 Eye Green to Spalding Improvement Scheme, from Peterborough, Cambridgeshire to Spalding, Lincolnshire, Newborough has practically been made an island with no suitable straightforward car-worthy routes being made available and several roads being closed in several directions at any one time. Because residents/visitors/commuters have been forced to use unsuitable roads, many road users have sustained expensive damage to their vehicles including costly suspension replacements and damage to the car chassis and wheels/tyres etc.  On top of that, many people cannot afford the extortionate increase in petrol costs sustained through such consistently badly-managed road closures and are looking to seek compensation.

There is extreme concern as to what would happen if a resident of Newborough or surrounding area(s) were to require an emergency service and the very real possibility that someone could in fact die as a result of emergency services being unable to reach them in time.

Please can something be done about this.
